alert.note: Alert for Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 11:57PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Washington County through 1245 AM MDT... At 1156 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong outflow winds from thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Woodlin School to 3 miles east of Cope, or along a line extending from 21 miles southwest of Akron to 26 miles north of Seibert. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Akron, Arickaree School, Cope, Anton and Elba. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. The strong winds will arrive well ahead of rain from these storms.
